Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2009 11:19PM wblibrary wrote: I just finished (TODAY) my last round of T/C - 4 rounds every three weeks- and I lost maybe 7-10 pounds.  I also took the Decadron sterioid and Zofran for nausea.  I was never nauseated - but have had constant bouts of diarrhea/constipation.  My appetite is not good on Days 4/5 through maybe 10. I get a "pasty" taste in my mouth and NOTHING tastes right for those days.  Otherwise, I still had an appetite and hunger.  I wouldn't worry about it.  Your body is going to be going through a lot during chemo - worrying about your weight gain/loss is not as important and making sure you get through chemo in the best possible health you can.
Posts.Title: Chemo and weight gain? A little insight please. Alo123 wblibrary

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 04:25AM wblibrary wrote: I am 5 months out of chemo and my hair is growing back - but it's not MY hair!  It is totally kinky curly and unmanagable.  I've been reading a few posts about getting hair cuts.  I have to ask - how long does this extreme curl last?  I had T/C chemo.  It's getting to be summer and I would love to go without my wig in the hot weather, but the way my hair looks right now - it's not an option.  I did go out a few times when it was just starting to grow in and it was grey.  I've dyed it since so the little ear hairs that peak out of the wig match.  Now I'm thinking - I'll just get it all cut off again and let it grow out grey.  I just HATE HATE HATE these kinky curls that have a mind of their own.  Any suggestions???
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 02:32PM wblibrary wrote: Mine didn't start growing back until at least 2 months after chemo.  I'm now 5 months out and it's still maybe only 1 - to 1 1/2 inches long.  But it's SO SO curly that it looks like it's only 1/4".  Everyone wants their hair to grow back so quickly, but I am so unhappy with what has grown back that I feel like I want to go shave my head again.  I'm having a very hard dealing with this hair that has grown back.  Summer is coming (I live where we have hot summers) and wearing a wig is almost impossible.  Going without is not even an option at this point cause my hair looks so bad.  I'm really getting depressed about this.  I HATE looking in the mirror to see someone who doesn't even look like me.  Goldie - you are dealing with this a lot better than I am at this point.  Everyone tells me to use a product - what product can take care of this head of hair that has a mind of it's own!  I'm totally frustrated.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 10:27PM wblibrary wrote: Does anyone know if Arimidex causes slow hair growth??

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 05:23PM wblibrary wrote: Anyone on here who is at least a year past chemo?  I'm curious to know if the curly hair that we are all experiencing does disappear after a few haircuts.    I'm six months post-chemo and I've still got someone else's hair on my head!  It's definitely not the hair I went into chemo with.  Does it ever go back to normal???

Posts.Content: wblibrary wrote: I just had to shout a little cause I'm happy!  I felt like a 12 year old going to get her first training bra today.  I got my prothesis and masectomy bra fitting today!  I can actually go out in public without feeling like I have to cover up with gathers - oversized - or jackets!  I've got boobs!  Let's hear it for the boobs - and the people who make them!  They are awesome people!  Wblibrary Dx 9/2008, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/10 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New Bra & Boob! wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2008 12:32PM - edited Nov 13, 2008 12:32PM by wblibrary Helga - you need to have her fitted by a professional.  The Cancer Society website is a great place to start to get names and places for a prosthesis and mastectomy bras.   Perhaps they can recommend somewhere in India for her to go or you to call to help her out.  My lady actually came to my hospital for my measurement and then I went to her shop for the final fitting.   She took care of all my insurance papers too.  I had a marvelous experience.  I hope you find the same for your sister.  Good luck
Posts.Title: New Bra & Boob! wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2008 08:44PM wblibrary wrote: Thanks everyone, I started my Neupogen shots yesterday so I'm hoping the coughing and phlegm will go away on it's own.  I give myself my second shot today - and then 3 more after that.  I feel like I've just got the flu or a really bad cold at this point.  I got told not to worry unless I hit 101 degree fever.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed that at the end of the shots - I will be feeling better.
Posts.Title: Phlegm wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: wblibrary wrote: I had my first round of chemo on Monday - 5 days ago.  Last night the side effects began.  I ran a low grade temp - 100.8 -and started coughing.  The fever is lower now, but I'm still coughing up a lot of green phlegm.  Is this normal?  Wblibrary Dx 9/2008, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 0/10 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Phlegm wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 07:19PM wblibrary wrote: Thanks to everyone - I ended up at the doctors getting a chest x-ray and blood tests.  I started geting a rapid heart beat too.  Well, it turns out I do have some sort of infection and I'm not on heavy duty antibiotics - x-ray was clear though.  So now I know - having "cold" side effects is NOT normal when you are on chemo.
Posts.Title: Phlegm wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2008 11:25PM - edited Nov 11, 2008 11:26PM by wblibrary Wait till you are 55 and you've just been handed back your LIFE - and NOW matching "girls" Somethings are worth telling the world!!!!
Posts.Title: New Bra & Boob! wblibrary wblibrary

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 12:02AM wblibrary wrote: AZ - I have my last T/C chemo treatment on 1/06/09!  I too felt just like you are feeling.  The new medications they have to keep nausea at a minimal are great!  You will be tired - that's just normal considering what your body is going through.  You may be either constipated or have the runs - everyone is different and you may vary from day to day.  Just eat well and drink, drink, drink fluids to flush your system.  The actual day of treatment is fine.  Usually Day 4 or 5 were my worst.  Just plan on staying home to see your body's response.  You'll be fine!  Honest!
Posts.Title: Nervous about starting Chemo 1/2/09 AZStacey2008 AZStacey2008
